notes: Bean didn't participate in Thursday's practice session for maintenance reasons.
Coronato won't take part in Thursday's skate for maintenance reasons.
Pospisil didn't participate in Thursday's practice session for maintenance reasons.

Doughty sustained a left ankle injury versus the Golden Knights on Wednesday (Sept. 25) and initial quick x-ray showed a fracture, but he's scheduled for additional imaging today, per Frank Seravalli of DailyFaceoff.
Kral was labeled day-to-day with a lower-body injury Wednesday, Wes Crosby of NHL.com reports.
Auston Matthews is dealing with an upper-body issue, per Leafs coach Craig Berube.
Lindgren won't return to Tuesday's preseason game versus the Islanders after suffering an upper-body injury in a fight, per Antonio Losada of Athlon Sports.
Bordeleau is week-to-week after suffering a lower-body injury, Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now reports.
Nosek is battling an upper-body injury and will miss some time as a result, Jameson Olive of the Panthers' official site reports.
Panarin left Tuesday's preseason game versus the Islanders with a lower-body injury and is still under evaluation, Peter Baugh of The Athletic reports.
D Artyom Levshunov is not expected to play in any preseason games. As per Scott Powers of The Athletic.
Carrier will not be an option against the Lightning on Tuesday, Chip Alexander of The Raleigh News & Observer reports.
F Teddy Blueger will not take part in Tuesday's preseason contest against Seattle, Ben Kuzma of The Vancouver Province reports.
Heinola is dealing with an ankle infection that is far worse than day-to-day, per Mike McIntyre of the Winnipeg Free Press.
Bjugstad will be listed as week-to-week and is not taking part in the start of training camp, per Craig Morgan of ALLCITY Network.
Sundqvist will take part in practices during training camp, but he isn't expected to participate in any preseason games, Jeremy Rutherford of The Athletic reports.
Vlasic will be sidelined versus Anaheim on Tuesday, Max Miller of NHL.com reports.
Mukhamadullin didn't take part in Tuesday's practice, per Curtis Pashelka of The San Jose Mercury News.
Marino is considered week-to-week with an upper-body injury and will not be on the ice Thursday for the start of training camp, according to Craig Morgan of ALLCITY Network.
Couture will not be available for the start of training camp, per rotowire.com.
Askarov was not in attendance for Tuesday's game-day skate and will miss out versus Anaheim, Curtis Pashelka of The San Jose Mercury News reports.
Demko has made a lot of progress over the last 2-3 weeks, but said Thursday there is still no timetable for his return, Harman Dayal of The Athletic reports.
Gaucher has a lower-body injury and is considered day-to-day ahead of training camp.
Pesce is making progress from his season-ending surgery he had in Carolina and he's considered week-to-week, per NJ Devils Reporter Amanda Stein.
The Calgary Flames announced that D Kevin Bahl will not participate in either of Calgary's split-squad games against Edmonton.
Guhle resumed skating on his own this morning and is being evaluated on a daily basis.
Mintyukov is dealing with a lower-body injury and is day-to-day to begin training camp.

General Manager Julien BriseBois said Mikey Eyssimont has a lower-body injury and the hope is that he can return to practicing on a regular basis by the end of camp, with an eye toward a mid-October return.
Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury that's expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
Karlsson continues to be classified as day-to-day but should be available for Opening Night against the Rangers on Oct. 9 after coach Mike Sullivan told reporters Thursday.
Dahlin, as expected, won't play in Tuesday's preseason clash with Pittsburgh, Lance Lysowski of The Buffalo News reports.
Kaneâs recovery from abdominal surgery is expected to take a minimum of five months. They suggest it could be six months â or longer, per Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic.

Jason Robertson had surgery on his foot on July 31. Heâs been non-weight bearing the last six weeks. He wonât be skating to start training camp with the main team. Heâll miss majority of camp, Jim Nill says.
Glendening could return by the Oct. 11 opener, Tampa Bay Lightning GM Julien BriseBois said.
Joshua announced that he underwent surgery for testicular cancer and will not be ready to join the team for training camp.
Sorokin had surgery to address a back injury this offseason but is not expected to miss any regular-season action, Stefen Rosner of NHL.com reports.
Lehkonen will not be able to participate fully at the start of training camp, John Matisz of The Score reports.
Miller will be undergoing surgery to repair damage to his right shoulder, per Jonathan Larivee of Hockey Feed.
Filmon will not participate in the team's Prospects Challenge due to an upper-body injury and is considered week-to-week.
The New Jersey Devils announced that D Luke Hughes suffered a left shoulder injury earlier this month during off-season training. Hughesâ recovery time is approximately six-eight weeks.
Krug will undergo surgery on his left ankle and will miss the entire 2024-25 season.
Jesper Fast has undergone neck surgery, and is not expected to play in the upcoming season. per Carolina Hurricanes.
Brossoit underwent meniscus repair surgery yesterday, out 5-7 weeks, which puts him back late end of training camp or beginning of regular season, per Frank Seravalli of Daily Faceoff.
Harvey-Pinard underwent successful surgery on Thursday after suffering a broken leg. The recovery period for the 25-year-old winger is estimated to be four months.
Nichushkin was placed in Stage 3 of the NHL/NHLPA player assistance program and suspended for a minimum of six months without pay for violating the terms of Stage 2, the NHL and NHLPA announced.
